intro: Acetosa pratensis subsp. thyrsiflora, commonly known as the thrysoflora or thrysoflora grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. The plant typically thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its specific ecological preferences and limited distribution.
